intro: Rubus horstensis, commonly known as the Horst's blackberry, is a species of brambles native to central and eastern Europe. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental and edible qualities, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
